content.description:
Sic dea summissosummissus, -a, -um, adj.: lowered contra SaturniaSaturnia, -ae, f.: Juno (the daughter of Saturn) Saturnia, -ae, f.: Juno, the daughter of Saturnvultu: 
“Ista quidem quia nota mihi tua, magne, voluntasvoluntas, -atis, f.: desire, 
Iuppiter, et Turnum et terras invita reliqui.”
content.question: In line 1, Sic dea summisso contra Saturnia vultu is translated

choices.label: Thus, the goddess Juno, lowering her expression in turn, says
Thus, opposite Juno, the goddess lowered her expression and says
Thus, in turn, the goddess Juno, with her expression lowered, says
Thus, Juno, with the goddess’s expression lowered against him, says

content.answer: Thus, in turn, the goddess Juno, with her expression lowered, says

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12
